statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Colbey Ross scored 23 points, Kameron Edwards added 16 and Pepperdine beat Towson 74-65 Friday night in the first round of the Island of the Bahamas Showcase.
article.headline: Pepperdine beats Towson behind 23 points from Ross
article.linkText: Pepperdine beats Towson behind 23 points from Ross
article.story: NASSAU, Bahamas -- Colbey Ross scored 23 points, Kameron Edwards added 16 and Pepperdine beat Towson 74-65 Friday night in the first round of the Island of the Bahamas Showcase. Eric Cooper Jr. scored 13 points for the Waves (2-1), who shot 45 percent from the field to the Tigers' 39 percent and made 20 of 21 free throws. Pepperdine advances to face Georgia Southern on Saturday night. Towson's Jordan McNeil tied it at 42 with a jumper early in the second half, but Cooper hit a 3 amid a 6-0 run and Pepperdine took the lead and pulled ahead by as many as 11 points before the final buzzer. Towson led 25-16 on Alex Thomas' jumper, but the Waves scored nine straight and led 33-29 after Edwards hit back-to-back 3-pointers. Edwards' jumper with 1:54 left in the first half put Pepperdine up 35-32 at halftime. Nakye Sanders and Brian Fobbs scored 11 apiece for the Tigers (1-2), who face FAU on Saturday.
